meanings.definition: The outer boundary of a shape or area.
meanings.sent1: The perimeters of the garden were marked by a fence.
meanings.sent2: The students measured the perimeters of different shapes in math class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the perimeters of the park were his personal running track.
meanings.sent4: The perimeters of her heart were guarded by high walls.
meanings.sent5: The perimeters of the haunted house were shrouded in mystery.

meanings.definition: The length of the boundary of a shape or area.
meanings.sent1: She calculated the perimeters of the rectangles in her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The perimeters of the field were outlined with colorful flags.
meanings.sent3: The perimeters of the cake were so delicious that she couldn't resist eating them first.
meanings.sent4: His words extended to the perimeters of the room, filling it with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The perimeters of the forest whispered secrets to those who dared to listen.
